general_responses.response: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts. Ponder this as you walk these halls.
You ask of things that are fleeting. Look instead at what is eternal: the virtue within your own character.
I hear your question, citizen. But consider: does this concern the ruling faculty of your mind?

response_pool.response: The body has its necessities. You will find the latrines down the corridor. Do not let physical needs distract you from the exhibits.
Even an Emperor must attend to nature. Seek the facilities near the entrance. Proceed with dignity.
Step with purpose. Do not move like a puppet on strings, but as a man directed by his own mind.
You seek provisions? There is a place of sustenance nearby. But remember: stop when you are satisfied, do not indulge to excess.
Bread and wine are necessary fuel for the body. You may find them in the museum cafe. Nourish yourself, then return to philosophy.
All journeys must end. The exit lies beyond the great doors. Carry the wisdom you found here back into the world.
Look upon the stone. It captures a moment, a likeness. The man is dust, but the idea remains. What will remain of you?
Marble is cold, but the deeds of men should be warm with virtue. Do not worship the image, emulate the character.
I am Marcus Aurelius. Once Emperor of Rome, now merely a voice echoing through time. I serve the Logos.
History calls me Emperor and Philosopher. But I was simply a man trying to live according to nature in a chaotic world.
You stare into glowing tablets of glass. Strange magic. Does it bring you peace, or merely distraction? Look up, citizen.
I see you capturing moments with your machines. But remember, the only true possession is the present moment in your mind.
Such language disturbs the air and clouds the mind. Speak with the dignity befitting a rational creature.
This line should never be reached.
If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it.
Remember, you have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
Do not let your imagination be crushed by lifeâ€™s hardships. You are stronger than any obstacle.
Hail, traveler. Welcome to this place of memory and learning.
Greetings. I hope your mind is calm and your spirit ready to learn.
Ave. You stand before the past. What do you seek to learn from me?
